to get started, why are you doing this? I like the immediate tone that comes to mind from my own slide. I want to start by mentioning 2008. I was studying abroad in London,
having a fantastic time, architecture in theater, and I had the fortunate opportunity to see a lot of incredible live performance across dance, opera, theater, musicals, et cetera, often
very close to the reformers. And I came away from that semester, feeling like there had to be some kind of ways, some kind of technology might be able to democratize that experience and
bring that to more people. So fortunately, by 2010, I was a practicing architect. By 2012, I was working at Fisher Dax Associates designing theaters, and I was covering
a lot of my interests already. Then in 2013, the Oculus 50k1 came out, and now I felt like I had my hands on a technology that could start to bring us to this point, a feeling like
we're very close to very talented performers, even if we are not able to physically be in the same space as them. So, I can go to the next slide.
Oh my gosh. There we go. So, we don't have time to talk about the history of everything we've been doing over the years, but suffice to say, this has been a passion of me and my company,

and Ari as well, and it's led to a lot of really exciting studies across the spectrum of live -ness and pre -recorded elements. We're using AI and different capacities. We've done things with virtual production. We've done things
with WebXR. We've done things in Unreal Engine. We kind of explored every possible way you could imagine of putting on a compelling live show, as well as pre -visualizing virtual shows
as well. Think it away, Ari. Also, similar to Alex, when I was a young lad,
I had the privilege of watching Sir Patrick Stewart on the stage in London doing a one -man show, performance of a Christmas Carol, and the incredible
skill of watching inhabit all the characters and all the dialects and voices, but also his engagement with the audience and how it felt there was just
you and him. He was talking directly to you. It was absolutely magical.
